The 'Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands' ('CNMI'; ) is one of two
insular areas that are Commonwealths of the United States; the other is Puerto
Rico. Both may also be classified as unincorporated, organized territories
of the United States. It consists of fifteen islands in the western
Pacific Ocean located about three-quarters of the way between Hawaii and the
Philippines. The United States Census Bureau reports the total land area of all
islands as . http://www.doi.gov/archive/oia/Islandpages/cnmipage.htm
As of the 2010 census, the Commonwealth has a population of 53,883, [http:/-
/2010.census.gov/news/pdf/cb11cn178_ia_cnmi_totalpop_2010map.pdf 2010
Census] of which over 90% live on the island of Saipan. Of the fourteen
other islands, only twoTinian and Rotaare permanently inhabited.

The Commonwealth's center of government is in the village of Capital Hill on
Saipan. As the island is governed as a single municipality, most publications
name Saipan as the Commonwealth's capital.
categories: Insular areas of the United States
